Jasad Backpacker Asal Inggris Ditemukan Mengambang di Laut
01 Nov 2019, 18:53 by Elmy Tasya Khairally


Foto:Amelia Bambridge (Reuters)

Kamboja - Jasad dari backpacker asal Inggris yang menghilang di pulau di Kamboja ditemukan mengambang di laut. Dia telah menghilang sekitar seminggu yang lalu.Polisi menemukan jasad Amelia Bambridge sekitar 30 mil dari tempat wisata Koh Rong, tempat terakhir kali orang-orang melihatnya. Menurut kepala Provinsi Preah Sihanouk, Chuon Narin, Kamboja dia ditemukan di perairan dekat perbatasan Thailand .dilansir dari Travel+Leisure, Amelia menghilang dari pesta pantai di pulau sekitar pukul 3 pagi waktu setempat tanggal 24 Oktober 2019. Beberapa waktu kemudian, Ransel miliknya yang berisi dompet, handphone dan kartu bank ditemukan.Keluarga Amelia terbang dari Sussex Barat, Inggris ke Kamboja. Mereka membantu upaya pencarian yang terdiri dari 150 orang di sekitar pulau, yang terdiri dari penyelam, angkatan laut, penduduk setempat dan turis yang bergabung dengan petugas kepolisian Kamboja yang mencarinya di darat dan laut.


Foto: Ayah Amelia (kiri) ikut membantu tim dalam proses pencarian anaknya (AFP)

Saudara perempuan Amelia, Georgie mengatakan bahwa terakhir kali Amelia menghubungi keluarga pada hari sebelum ia menghilang. Dia mengirimkan pesan dan mengatakan betapa menakjubkan perjalanannya."Dia ingin menjelajahi dunia, menjalani kehidupan tanpa penyesalan," kata saudara Amelia, Georgie.Amelia akhirnya ditemukan mengambang di laut. Belum diketahui penyebab hilangnya dan kematian dan Amelia, namun polisi berspekulasi bahwa Amelia telah tenggelam berdasarkan laporan sebelumnya. Sebuah organisasi yang didedikasikan untuk membantu keluarga untuk mencari orang yang dicinta, Lucie Blackman telah membantu keluarga Amelia dan membenarkan berita tragis ini.

[Gambas:Twitter]

Saudara perempuan Amelia dan saudara laki-lakinya membagikan sebuah postingan di Facebook. Mereka mengkonfirmasi berita tragis ini."Saya mendapatkan konfirmasi yang paling mengerikan bahwa saudara perempuan saya, Amelia Bambridge ditemukan dan meninggal dunia," tulis saudara perempuan Amelia, Sharon Schultz.Dia menambahkan, bahwa hatinya hancur saat keluarga dan temannya harus mengetahui kejadian ini. "Hati saya hancur membiarkan keluarga dan teman dekat saya mengetahui berita yang menghebohkan dan tidak kita inginkan. Sekarang kami harus membawa Amelia kembali ke Inggris agar kita bisa meletakkan jiwanya yang indah untuk beristirahat dan mengingat kehidupan indah yang ia jalani," tambahnya.Simak Video "WNI Selundupkan Narkoba Senilai Rp 14 M ke Filipina"[Gambas:Video 20detik](aff/aff)

Backpacker Bodies from England Found Floating in the Sea
Nov 1, 2019, 18:53 by Elmy Tasya Khairally


Photo: Amelia Bambridge (Reuters)

Cambodia - The body of a British backpacker who disappeared on an island in Cambodia was found floating in the sea. He had disappeared about a week ago. The police found the body of Amelia Bambridge about 30 miles from the tourist resort of Koh Rong, where people last saw him. According to the head of Preah Sihanouk Province, Chuon Narin, Cambodia he was found in waters near the Thai border. Reported from Travel + Leisure, Amelia disappeared from a beach party on the island at around 3 am local time on October 24, 2019. Some time later, his backpack containing wallet, handphone and bank card found. Amelia's family flew from West Sussex, England to Cambodia. They helped the search effort consisting of 150 people around the island, which consisted of divers, navy, locals and tourists who joined the Cambodian police officers who were looking for him on land and sea.


Photo: Amelia's father (left) helps the team in the process of finding her child (AFP)

Amelia's sister Georgie said that the last time Amelia contacted the family was the day before she disappeared. He sent a message and said how amazing his journey was. "He wanted to explore the world, live a life without regrets," said Amelia's sister, Georgie. Amelia was finally found floating in the sea. The cause and death of Amelia are not yet known, but police speculate that Amelia has drowned based on previous reports. An organization dedicated to helping families find loved ones, Lucie Blackman has helped Amelia's family and confirmed this tragic news.

[Gambas: Twitter]

Amelia's sister and brother shared a post on Facebook. They confirmed this tragic news. "I have the most terrible confirmation that my sister, Amelia Bambridge was found and died," wrote Amelia's sister, Sharon Schultz. She added that her heart was broken when her family and friends had to know about this incident. "It broke my heart to let my family and close friends know the horrendous and unwanted news. Now we have to bring Amelia back to England so we can put her beautiful soul to rest and remember the beautiful life she lived," he added.
